TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WSFederationHttpSecurityMode extends System.Enum

remarks.para: This enumeration defines the security modes that the supports.

summary.para: Specifies the different security modes for .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode Message = int32(1)

summary.para: Integrity, confidentiality, server authentication and client authentication are provided using SOAP message security. By default, the body is encrypted and signed. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode None = int32(0)

summary.para: The SOAP message is not secure during transfer. No Security Token Service is contacted. This mode is equivalent to using the wsHttpBinding binding with SecurityMode.None.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode TransportWithMessageCredential = int32(2)

summary.para: Integrity, confidentiality and server authentication are provided by HTTPS. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is provided by means of SOAP message security and is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.
